title: Max Grezlik
section: Hi, I’m Max Grezlik — Fishery Data Analyst
text:
Hi, I’m Max Grezlik — Fishery Data Analyst
I’m a fisheries scientist with a passion for data-driven solutions in marine conservation and resource management. My work bridges the gap between ecological research and applied fisheries science, with a strong focus on quantitative methods, ecosystem based fisheries management, and sustainable fisheries.
I regularly use R, RStudio, and GitHub to build tools, analyze complex datasets, and communicate findings. This site is a hub for my current projects, publications, and CV.
Whether you’re a collaborator, a fellow scientist, or just curious about fisheries research, welcome!

title: Maxwell T. Grezlik
text:
Authorship 
Grezlik, Maxwell T., “Evaluating the effects of Atlantic menhaden management and environmental change on the northwest Atlantic Ocean ecosystem” (2021). HSU theses and projects. 519. https://digitalcommons.humboldt.edu/etd/519 
Karp, Melissa A., Link, J., Grezlik, M., Cadrin, S., Fay, G., Lynch, P., Townsend, H., Methot, R. (eds.). 2023. Increasing the uptake of multispecies models in fisheries management. ICES Journal of Marine Science. https://doi.org/10.1093/icesjms/fsad001 
Karp, M. A., Grezlik, M., Link, J., Cadrin, S., Fay, G., Lynch, P., Townsend, H., Methot, R. (2021). Workshop report: Multispecies Modeling Applications in Fisheries Management, hosted virtually by NMFS and UMASS-SMAST, June 22-24, 2021. NOAA Technical Memorandum NMFS-F/SPO-223.
